headline: Apple Oatmeal Crisp
description: This apple crisp recipe with oats and melted butter features a crunchy crust on the top and bottom for a deliciously tasty apple dessert.

video.description: See how to make a simple apple dessert that’s ready in an hour.
video.name: Apple Oatmeal Crisp

name: Apple Oatmeal Crisp
recipeIngredient: 3 cups apples - peeled, cored and chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8-inch square pan.
Place brown sugar, oats, flour, and butter in a large bowl; mix until crumbly.
Place 1/2 of the crumb mixture in the bottom of the prepared pan. Spread apples evenly over crumb mixture.
Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon; top with remaining crumb mixture.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 40 to 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: This was good, but a little dry. I made a syrup using butter brown sugar an a little white sugar, and added some cinnamon. Mad it in microwave. Poured the syrup over top and it made it just right!
It was dry, as some have noted. Agree with mixing the sugar and cinnamon with the apples instead of sprinkling on top. Next time I will try a different recipe.
The ingredient amounts are way off. Not enough mix to cover an 8 X 8 pan. Double the oats and flour.
Delicious with any fruit as a base. Poured out a jar of blueberry pie filling and then I put all the crisp on top instead of making it a sandwich. Will be trying my peach pie filling next!
I followed the recipe to the T. They taste good but did not rise at all. It was not the yeast; it had a good date on it.
Exactly how I've made it for 50 years! Ice cream or whipped cream and it can't be beat!!
I made it by instructions, but with about 4 cups of apples chopped. Was wonderful! Next time will try with some raisins.
Way too sweet and dry and not edible. Very disappointed with it. However, I made my own adjustments and was happy with the results.
Simple and very tasty! Will be a go to for our family.
It was way too sweet. If I were to make it again, I will cut down the sugar. A cup of brown sugar plus 1/2 cup of granulated sugar makes the result unpalatable.

I love this recipe!! The first time I fixed it I used apple pie filling because I had no fresh apples in the house. It was so wonderful that I'm getting requests to make it again. So, I decided to put a different 'spin' on it and make it with raspberry pie filling today. Again, It was a hit. That along with a fresh cup of coffee!! Wonderful!! Thank you so much for this recipe I know this is a keeper for us and one that we will be reaching for time after time.
This is the best apple crisp I have ever made! I did not melt the butter, but instead cut it into little chunks and it came out amazing. Thank you for the recipe!
Came out great. Used six apples and it helps if cut thin instead chunks. Used 3/4 flour instead one. And added pecans to topping mix.
We like it great with ice cream or whip cream

SO delicious! Used all Granny Smith apples. Made it diabetic friendlier by using Allulose and brown “sugar” stevia. Used Kodiak pancake mix instead of flour. Added a little vanilla to apples. This is a winner! Family loved it; thank you for this easy recipe!
Added about 1 tsp vanilla to the butter and 1\2 cup chopped walnuts on top of the apples smells delicious and plan to serve with homemade vanilla ice cream
Loved it! So did my family
Great, great, great.

A bit dry but still crispy. I used only 1 cup of brown sugar and it’s already a bit too sweet. Next time will try 3/4 or even half. I didn’t use white sugar at all cause apples are already sweet naturally. And instead of sprinkling cinnamon, it’s better to mix it evenly with the apple first. Also, I put only 3/4 cup of flour and used 4 apples instead.

I started making this recipe more than 11 years ago. I love it. I stopped baking for almost 10 years so this is the first time I've made it in a long time. If I need to, I add a little extra butter to the mix so that it spreads more easily in the pan. I also chop closer to 4 cups of apples. I think that my apples were too chunky, and next time I will chop them finer. Sprinkling the cane sugar or Swerve or combination, right over the apples, and then putting the top layer on, is perfect.

So far so good it's in the oven right now so I shall add my final decision once I've tasted the master piece ..... I did like how easy it was to follow how ever the half cup of white sugar and the the 2tbs of cinnamon wasn't really explained and what it did say seemed way over board to mix it all in the apples so we shall see it's different then ltge one I'm used to but it was quick smooth and easy to follow.....Taste Test Will follow .....

I thought it was horrible. I mean you must have left out an ingredient because I read the recipe several times. I put in the ingredients and still incredibly dry.
I feel like I wasted my time and the ingredients I did have.
I don't know who submitted this recipe but it shouldn't be published when not complete. I am very sorry I made this
The recipe is very easy! The only thing I did differently was tossed the apples with the white sugar & cinnamon. This added more juiciness to the apples! Delicious!
Nice and simple to make. A little too sweet. Next time I'll cut back the brown sugar to 1/2 cup.
No i did not change anything and enjoyed it very much!

My MOST FAVORITE version. I love the crisp crust on the bottom with the fruit in the middle and the crunchy topping on top. I have made this with canned apple pie filling and cherries. Comes out YUMMY every time! Quick and easy and suitable for company and church potlucks.

This was a good recipe but next time I’d make a couple of changes. I would use a little less flour and pure cane sugar. Apples have a natural sweetness to them already so 1/2 cup of sugar on top in addition to the brown sugar is a lot.
Will be making this again. Now I need to purchase an apple corer.
Made it according to directions. Turned out great. Thank you!
I added some blueberries and raspberries I needed to use up and it turned out great! I also added a some graham cracker crumbs, yum!

Like millions I've bee cooking and baking up a storm. I can't believe I've never made apple crisp so when the buzzer rang, I was eager to taste the results after a bean stew and hard bread and cheese. It is perfect! Perfect in sweetness and moisture. I lightened up on sugar/cinnamon mixture by a third. Thanks for a wonderful treat!

I liked it and thought it was good. I added about four cups of apples because I wanted more apples in mine. I also used an electric mixer to mix my "dry" ingredients. Next time, I want to mix the flour, brown sugar, and butter in the mixer and then fluff in the oatmeal or even add an extra cup of oatmeal to give the crisp a meatier oaty taste.
Absolutely delicious!
Easy, and tasty! I doubled the recipe, and added raspberries and nutmeg. This will be on regular rotation in our family.

I made this using apples from our weekend apple picking. Since I was using a variety of apples, I used the entire 1/2 cup of white sugar. Followed recipe exactly as written. Makes a wonderful, buttery, brown sugary crisp. Delicious!
This was a big hit with my family today!
great recipe. I used Honeycrisp apples and if I do that again, I'll cut the white sugar by 25%. The recipe was really good but just a touch too sweet with these apples.
Delicious as written!
Wonderful recipe. I
Delicious and disappears fast!! It is a little sweet but amazing! I used gala apples and didn’t remove skin. I’ll have to make again so I can get more than a small serving!!
Husband loved it and it was very simple!

This was deeeeelicious! I modified the recipe and used about half of the sugar amount listed for both the apples and the crisp portion and it was plenty sweet. I probably could have used a quarter of the amount and it would probably still be OK (will try that next time because I try not to have too much sugar). I used 1.5 cups of oatmeal and half a cup of flour per one of the other suggestions and it was the right amount of crisp. For the apple mixture, I added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon (3 total). I will definitely make again! Thank you for the recipe!

I bumped up this recipe a little bit and the end result was fantastic. I added walnuts to the topping and I tossed the apples with the cinnamon sugar and sprinkled it with half of a fresh lemon tossed in some rum and viola!!

I loved the idea of topping on the bottom and top as that's my favorite part of Apple Crisp. I found this one to be great. I didn't think it had enough filling (i.e. apples) so the next time I will use more than the 3 cups.

Love this recipe. I took another reviewer’s advice and shook up the apples, cinnamon and sugar in a ziplock bag. This was so easy to put together and it’s delicious. This is my go to recipe for apple crisp. Simple and flavorful!
I omitted the white sugar and brown sugar. Used 1 cup of raw sugar in its place. Loved it
Turned out great and smells awesome!!!

Excellent recipe and reminds me of the apple crisp my mother made when I was young. My family loved it, but I plan to add less white sugar next time as it was a little too sweet for my taste. I'll definitely make it again!

Awesome recipe and super easy to make. I didnt have any all purpose flour so I used half cup of self rising flour and half cup of almond flour. I hope I turns out. The oven timer just went off. And yes its amazing ??
Since a lot of the reviews mentioned the end result was a bit dry. I sprinkled a bit water on the apple pieces and it came out great. Healthy yet delicious!
Very good just added a little nutmeg
Excellent crisp! I used Granny Smith apples and only used about 1/4 cup of the white sugar. And it was plenty sweet. I will make this again and again.
bit soggy
Easy to make and tastes great. I used less sugar (3/4 brown and 1/4 white). added extra cinnamon with some coconut and roasted cardamom and 1 clove. Perfect with some vanilla custard.
Too sweat. I made this with Granny Smith apples. I could only taste sugar. A recipe with more oats would better. I also had to broil it for 5 minutes at the end to get the top to crisp.

Very tasty! I agree it didn't need white sugar mixed in due to the sweetness from the brown sugar, but it all depends on personal preference & types of apples used. I used Michigan & Gala apples. Want to try again with some Granny Smith's mixed in!
This recipe had good flavor but I would double the amount of apples next time! :)

I tried this today for family dinner and it was great. easy and delicious. I sprayed the pan with cooking spray and I'm glad I did because it stuck a little after it cooled. the flavor was excellent and my 14 year old grandson had two helpings and took home most of what was left. I used pink lady apples because I've found they hold up well when baked and have a wonderful sweet apple flavor. great, easy treat!

It's so simple and a quick dessert in no time. Tastes yummy. Everyone likes it.
I always have apples on hand so this is a no-brainer
Thanks !

It was very dry and even with tweaking the recipe, no white sugar, adding nutmeg and more butter, the crisp was just crumbs of brown sugar. I think less flour and combining the crumb and the apples might help, along with a little lemon and ginger. I used a combination of Granny Smith and a new sweet, juicy variety of apples.

This is a KISS (Keep It Simple Sweetheart) recipe and makes a great basic crumble. Works with peaches, pears and cherries too. I like to keep the peels on the fruit and use the juice of a lemon to balance the sweetness of the crusts. And the smell of apples and cinnamon on a snowy Canadian enter day ... heaven in a bowl!
Great, delicious recipe.
Tasted pretty good. I think it would be much simpler to make by NOT melting the butter. And that would make it less "dry" tasting. And it would crumble more easily.
added 2 tsp rum for lil better flavor
Delicious and easy to make. Made this for a family gathering..everyone loved it!
Followed the recipe to the letter and it turned out beautifully. Will definitely make this again, no question. I used 2 honeycrisp and a granny smith apple.

Great, easy recipe. I added raisins and half a teaspoon of nutmeg to give just a touch of warmth. Served with vanilla ice cream made a delicious dessert to share. I've made it twice in 3 days to take to friend's house.
I have made this many times and this time I changed things up some. I didn’t have any apples so I used strawberry banana mixture. Not bad and I added some ground hazelnuts.
I made this for the first time, tonight. It came out great. Im a diabetic so I only used half the white sugar and ut was perfect! Thank you!

I only had 2 apples but I NEEDED apple crisp ... I just cut the recipe to 1/3 of everything... turned out awesome! Not at all dry like some whiners and complainers mentions ... ignore the nay-sayers - this recipe rocks!
It was easy to make and turned out great!

I mixed some of the cinnamon and sugar with the apples and sprinkled what was left in top of the apples. I also increased everything but the cinnamon by half of what it called for and used 10 apples to put in a 13 x 9 pan.

I’ve made this recipe more times than I can count and I get RAVE reviews everytime! Seriously family and friends ask me to make it constantly. I always double the recipe and use a 9x13 pan, also instead of sprinkling the cinnamon sugar on the apples I mix them beforehand. But seriously try this if you haven’t it’s HEAVENLY
Turned out great added raisons and some chopped walnuts . Smells wonderful while it bakes.
Very quick and easy recipe. I love the taste and texture. I did add a little bit of butter before the top crumble to help with moisture.

This recipe was a little too sweet for us using Cortland apples. It probably would be fine with Granny Smith however. I would cut back a smidgen on the sugars next time but it was still was a good dessert and everyone enjoyed it.

This recipe was very good and easy as i melted the butter per recipe. I made it as written. It was done 10 minutes early and the topping did get a little burnt, but i was able to scrape it off and with a scoop of vanilla ice cream, no one but me was the wiser

Loved It! Followed the recipe exactly as it was written with one minor exception: I did mix the cinnamon and sugar with the apples first in a separate bowl instead of just sprinkling in on the apples - extra bowl yes, but I feel like it helped evenly coat the apples. Turned out wonderful and it was all gone by the next day. It reheated nicely on day #2 straight from the fridge. I will definitely make this again.
We loved it. I now use that crumble on other cobbler type dishes

This apple crisp taste fine but it's awfully dry. I used nearly 5 cups of apples and added cinnamon because it seemed to me that it would be dry and it still was. My suggestion is that it's a fine recipe but you will need to add some apple juice to the mix. Maybe drizzle it on before baking. I will serve it with creme fraiche.
If I make this again I will eliminate the white sugar. One cup of brown sugar is plenty. Way too sweet!

This smelled so good while it was baking, but I felt it was too sweet and too cinnamony. I followed the directions exactly as written. Next time I plan to cut the cinnamon in half and probably cut the sugar that is sprinkled on top the apples also in half.
No changes
I did not change a thing, and I will make it exactly the same next time. Delicious.

Not good. I did exactly as written, with topping on top and bottom. The topping never really baked into the apples and it was like powdery flour and oats on top of crunchy apples. Maybe the type of apple you use is a factor, but this is just not appealing at all.
Followed the recipe accordingly but the dish came out very dry. Will certainly not trying this recipe again.

Delicious! It is a very easy recipe! I used 3 large Granny Smith apples (was about 4 cups). I used a Jr. Cake pan (8x11 inch pan) and it was a perfect size for this. Next time I will maybe use one more apple for my size of pan. I will use this recipe from now on!
This was very good and I will definitely make it again. Will probably reduce the amount of sugar though as it was very sweet.

I didn't make any changes and will def do it again!
It is divine and my husband and kids loved it as well
I added shredded coconut and pecans to mine and it was delicious.
Just right! Like the way the apples are layered between the crumbs!
Love this I made it for my family
Very sweet! I like my apples more tart. Next time I will not use the 1/2 cup of sugar on apples. I will use 1 tablespoon sugar with the cinnamon. Otherwise, great recipe.

This is my go to recipe with a few changes. I use 1/4 c of sugar and the same amount of cinnamon for the cinnamon sugar mix. I find that using the full 1/2 c of white sugar makes it too sweet. As far as the dryness, the recipe as is, is too dry for my taste, to combat this, after washing the apples, I don't dry the apples and I also sprinkle 1-2 tabs of water on top of the apples after I put the first layer of crumple and the apples down. This makes for a gooey bottom that I love have fallen in love with.
Wife saidbest desert she has ever eaten.
Easy and delicious
Followed recipe exactly as written& it was amazingly delicious like a high end restaurant especially hot with a little vanilla ice cream.
Great dessert! Thank you for sharing your grandmother's recipe!
too dry, needed ice cream to make it edible
